title: Inconsistent escaping of Macro output.
body:
Macro output is supposed to be safe, but it is not in some circumstances.  For instance:

```
>>> env = jinja2.Environment(autoescape=False, extensions=[jinja2.ext.autoescape])                 
>>> template = "{% macro m() %}<html>{% endmacro %}"
>>> template += "{% autoescape true %}{{ m() }}{% endautoescape %}"
>>> env.from_string(template).render()
u'<html>'
```

Also:

```
>>> env = jinja2.Environment(autoescape=False)                 
>>> template = "{% macro m() %}<html>{% endmacro %}{{ m()|e }}"
>>> env.from_string(template).render()
u'<html>'
```

Only by changing the global autoescape value to true, is the macro output now safe:

```
>>> env = jinja2.Environment(autoescape=True, extensions=[jinja2.ext.autoescape])
>>> template = "{% macro m() %}<html>{% endmacro %}"
>>> template += "{% autoescape true %}{{ m() }}{% endautoescape %}"
>>> env.from_string(template).render()
u'<html>'
```

And:

```
>>> env = jinja2.Environment(autoescape=True)                 
>>> template = "{% macro m() %}<html>{% endmacro %}{{ m()|e }}"
>>> env.from_string(template).render()
u'<html>'
```

Interestingly, this problem doesn't exist if the macro definition occurs inside the autoescape block:

```
>>> env = jinja2.Environment(autoescape=False, extensions=[jinja2.ext.autoescape])
>>> template = "{% autoescape true %}{% macro m() %}<html>{% endmacro %}"
>>> template += "{{ m() }}{% endautoescape %}"
>>> env.from_string(template).render()
u'<html>'
```
